alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 9:55PM CDT until May 16 at 10:20PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Current River near Powder Mill affecting Shannon County. Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 4.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 10.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 08/10/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
